result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean A Saidai

records.addlTxt:
10:34 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Defendant Sean A Saidai not in court.  Attorney Amy C Scholz in court for Sean A Saidai (appeared earlier in the day)
Attorney appears by authorization. 
Matter called and Atty Scholz requests a new date.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:38 AM  Defendant Sean A Saidai not in court.  Attorney Amy C Scholz in court for Sean A Saidai.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney appears by authorization. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Scholz is still waiting on offer from the State. 
State will forward offer today.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

01:36 PM Attorney Amy C Scholz in court.   Defendant Sean A Saidai did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization.
Atty Scholz requests a new date as she has just ben handed discovery in this matter today. 
State does not object.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to Appear filed by Atty. Amy Scholz

Apply cash bail previously posted.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:48 AM Defendant Sean A Saidai in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
